channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Now the Left Cares About Free Speech Again
item.description: That’s often not been the case in recent years.

item.title: Jerome Powell says Gen Z without tech skills are getting crushed in the ’low-hire, low-fire’ job market—and colleges are failing them
item.description: While a major economic issue, there’s not much the Fed can do about that, he said.

item.title: One big winner of Trump’s H1-B crackdown could be Canada
item.description: Every time new H1-B restrictions appear, jobs go to Canada.

item.title: If Only We’d Fight as Hard to Save Our Democracy as Ukrainians Are to Save Theirs
item.description: Ukrainians know that they can no longer count on an American democracy to save them.

item.title: F.D.A.’s Approval of Drug for Autism Upends Review Process
item.description: The agency revived an old treatment for cancer patients, unilaterally approving it for a subset of people with autism. Experts worry that the narrower...

item.title: Stanford scientists warn that AI ‘workslop’ is a stealthy threat to productivity—and a giant time suck
item.description: Lazy AI-generated work and communication is not only slowing people down; it’s also leading employees to lose respect for each other. Here’s how to pr...

item.title: ABC Affiliate Owners Boycott Jimmy Kimmel’s Return to Late Night
item.description: Together, the two TV station groups, Sinclair and Nexstar, control more than 20 percent of ABC’s local affiliates.

item.title: Oracle founder Larry Ellison has pledged to give away 95% of his $393B fortune—but sudden leadership changes fuel a mystery
item.description: Ellison has a history of changing his plans for distributing wealth.

item.title: OpenAI, Oracle, and Softbank expand Stargate with five new AI data centers, staging Texas media spectacle to counter critics
item.description: The companies drew reporters to rural West Texas to tour their flagship site and announce five new data centers. The show of force, timed with Oracle’...

item.title: TikTok Deal Could Make Oracle Founder Larry Ellison a New Kind of Media Mogul
item.description: The database billionaire and his son, David, are Trump favorites. The family could soon control an empire that includes CBS, Paramount, Warner, CNN an...

item.title: Fact-Checking Trump’s Speech at the U.N. General Assembly
item.description: The president made inaccurate claims about the economy, renewable energy and the mayor of London.

item.title: Supreme Leader Says Iran Has No Plans for Nuclear Weapon
item.description: The speech came as Iran and Europe negotiate over sanctions on the sidelines at the U.N. General Assembly. But Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said he opposed ...

item.title: U.S. Deportee Sent to Africa Is Repatriated by Jamaica
item.description: The decision by the Trump administration to send Orville Etoria to Eswatini, where he had no ties, raised alarm among rights groups.

item.title: Drone Sightings Force Copenhagen and Oslo Airports to Close Temporarily
item.description: It was not clear who was behind the episode, but Denmark’s prime minister called it the “most serious attack so far” on her country’s infrastructure.

item.title: Live Updates: After Meeting With Zelensky at U.N., Trump Shifts Stance on Russia
item.description: President Trump said Ukraine might be able to reclaim all its lost territory in the war against Russia. Earlier, he suggested NATO countries should sh...
